config.description: Defines how the HiveMQ Platform configuration is deployed as a Kubernetes object.

annotations.description: Defines specific annotations to be applied to the Kubernetes ConfigMap or Kubernetes Secret that contains the HiveMQ Platform configuration.

create.description: Boolean value, that configures whether to use a default HiveMQ configuration.

createAs.description: Defines how the HiveMQ Platform configuration should be stored into. Either a Kubernetes ConfigMap or a Kubernetes Secret.

customLogbackConfig.description: Optional setting to provide a custom HiveMQ Platform logging configuration (logback.xml) from a file using --set-file config.customLogbackConfig=your-logback-config.xml.

customTracingConfig.description: Optional setting to provide a custom HiveMQ Platform tracing configuration (tracing.xml) from a file using --set-file config.customTracingConfig=your-tracing-config.xml.

dataHub.description: Optional setting to enable HiveMQ Data Hub functionality.

behaviorValidationEnabled.description: Optional setting to enable data validation.

dataValidationEnabled.description: Optional setting to enable behavior validation.

labels.description: Defines specific labels to be applied to the Kubernetes ConfigMap or Kubernetes Secret that contains the HiveMQ Platform configuration.

name.description: The name of an existing Kubernetes ConfigMap or Secret with a valid HiveMQ configuration.

overrideHiveMQConfig.description: Optional setting to provide the HiveMQ configuration from a file using --set-file config.overrideHiveMQConfig=your-hivemq-config.xml.

overrideStatefulSet.description: Optional setting to provide the StatefulSetSpec configuration from a file using --set-file config.overrideStateFulSet=your-statefulsetspec.yml.

skipHttpsCertificateValidation.description: Configures if certificate validation should be skipped for downloads of custom extensions or extension customizations.

skipHttpsHostnameVerification.description: Configures if hostname verification should be skipped for downloads of custom extensions or extension customizations.

hivemqClientEventHistory.description: Configures HiveMQ Client Event History options.

replicaCount.description: Number of replicas to be persisted across cluster nodes.

keepAliveAllowUnlimited.description: Defines whether clients can have unlimited keep alive.

keepAliveMax.description: Defines the maximum keep alive value that a client can set.

maxPacketSize.description: Defines the maximum packet size that the broker accepts from clients.

maxQualityOfService.description: Defines the maximum Quality of Service (QoS) level allowed in MQTT PUBLISH messages.

messageExpiryMaxInterval.description: Defines the maximum message expiry value that clients can set.

queuedMessagesMaxSize.description: Sets the maximum number of messages the HiveMQ broker can store per client.

queuedMessagesStrategy.description: Defines how messages that arrive at the HiveMQ broker when the message queue of the corresponding client is full are handled.

retainedMessages.description: Defines whether retained messages are supported.

serverReceiveMaximum.description: Defines the maximum number of concurrent publishes the broker accepts from one client.

sharedSubscriptions.description: Defines whether clients can use shared subscriptions.

sessionExpiryMaxInterval.description: Defines the maximum session expiry value that clients can set.

subscriptionIdentifier.description: Defines whether clients can use subscription identifiers to associate received publishes with their subscriptions.

topicAliasEnabled.description: Defines whether topic aliases are enabled by the broker.

topicAliasMaxPerClient.description: The number of topic aliases available per client.

wildcardSubscriptions.description: Defines whether clients can use wildcard characters in topic filters.

hivemqMqttAddons.description: Configures HiveMQ MQTT Add-on options. See https://docs.hivemq.com/hivemq/latest/user-guide/mqtt-add-ons.html.

deadMessagesTopic.description: Captures all dead messages on the HiveMQ system.

droppedMessagesTopic.description: Captures all dropped messages on the HiveMQ system.

expiredMessagesTopic.description: Captures all expired messages on the HiveMQ system.

hivemqMqttSecurity.description: Configures HiveMQ MQTT security options. See https://docs.hivemq.com/hivemq/latest/user-guide/configuration.html#security.

allowEmptyClientId.description: Allows the use of empty client ids. If this is set to true, HiveMQ automatically generates random client ids, when clientId in the CONNECT packet is empty.

allowRequestProblemInformation.description: Allows the client to request the problem information. When set to false, no reason string or user property values are sent to clients.

controlCenterAuditLog.description: If audit logging for the control center is enabled.

payloadFormatValidation.description: Enables the UTF-8 validation of UTF-8 PUBLISH payloads.

restApiAuditLog.description: Defines whether audit logging for the REST API is enabled.

utf8Validation.description: Enables the UTF-8 validation of topic names and client IDs.

hivemqOverloadProtection.description: Configures HiveMQ Cluster overload protection. See https://docs.hivemq.com/hivemq/latest/user-guide/overload-protection.html.

enabled.description: Enables the HiveMQ Cluster overload protection.

hivemqRestrictions.description: Configures the HiveMQ restriction options. See https://docs.hivemq.com/hivemq/latest/user-guide/restrictions.html.

incomingBandwidthThrottling.description: The maximum incoming traffic as bytes per second (b/s).

maxClientIdLength.description: The maximum number of characters HiveMQ accepts in an MQTT-client ID.

maxConnections.description: The maximum number of concurrent MQTT connections the HiveMQ instance allows.

maxTopicLength.description: The maximum number of characters HiveMQ accepts in a topic string.

noConnectIdleTimeout.description: The time in milliseconds that HiveMQ waits for a CONNECT message of a client before an open TCP socket is closed.

license.description: Defines all HiveMQ licenses to be used for the HiveMQ Platform.

additionalLicenses.description: Adds additional main HiveMQ licenses to the Kubernetes Secret as .lic files, if needed.

annotations.description: Defines specific annotations to be applied to the Kubernetes Secret that contains the HiveMQ licenses.

create.description: Creates a Kubernetes Secret for all configured HiveMQ licenses.

data.description: The main HiveMQ license as a string. By default, this data must be a Base64 encoded string. Otherwise, set isLicenseBase64Encoded=false to use a clear string.

dataHub.description: Configures a list of HiveMQ Data Hub licenses to include as part of the Kubernetes Secret.

extensions.description: Defines a list of HiveMQ Enterprise Extension licenses to include as part of the Kubernetes Secret.

labels.description: Defines specific labels to be applied to the Kubernetes Secret that contains the HiveMQ licenses.

name.description: Defines the name of the Kubernetes Secret that contains the HiveMQ licenses.

overrideLicense.description: Sets the main HiveMQ license with your own file from a specified license path.

isLicenseBase64Encoded.description: Configures whether to use a Base64 encoded string (data) or clear string (stringData) for the Kubernetes Secret. The default setting is `true`.

monitoring.description: Enables the ServiceMonitor resource and Grafana dashboard creation for the platform.

enabled.description: Defines whether the monitoring configuration for the HiveMQ Platform is enabled. The default setting is `false`.

create.description: Boolean value that configures whether to use the default HiveMQ Platform Grafana dashboard ConfigMap. The default setting is `true`.

namespace.description: Namespace where to deploy the Grafana dashboard ConfigMap. Defaults to the namespace of the HiveMQ Platform.

overrideDashboard.description: Sets the Grafana dashboard content for the HiveMQ Platform Grafana dashboard ConfigMap with your own JSON file from a specified path.

interval.description: Defines how often Prometheus scrapes metrics from the operator endpoints. Valid formats include `1d`, `1h30m`, `5m`, and `10s`. Defaults to 15 seconds.

namespace.description: Namespace where to deploy the ServiceMonitor. Defaults to the namespace of the HiveMQ Platform.

releaseName.description: Helm chart release name of the Prometheus Monitoring stack available in the Kubernetes cluster. Defaults to the HiveMQ Platform Helm chart release name.

scrapeTimeout.description: Defines the maximum duration allowed for scraping metrics from the endpoints defined in the ServiceMonitor resource. Valid formats include `1d`, `1h30m`, `5m`, and `10s`. Defaults to 10 seconds.

containerSecurityContext.description: Configures container security for both HiveMQ Init and HiveMQ main container. Some fields are present in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext. When both are set, the values in SecurityContext take precedence.

podSecurityContext.description: Configures pod-level security for the HiveMQ Platform pod. Some fields are also present in container.securityContext. Field values of container.securityContext take precedence over field values of PodSecurityContext.

operator.description: Provides the selection criteria to identify which operator manages the selected HiveMQ Platform custom resource.

annotations.description: Annotations to add to the HiveMQ Platform custom resource.

labels.description: Labels to add to the HiveMQ Platform custom resource.

selector.description: Selector name to configure which HiveMQ Platform Operator manages this platform.

hivemqConnectOverloadProtection.description: Configures the connect overload protection for the HiveMQ MQTT and WebSocket listeners.

connectBurstSize.description:
The maximum amount of simultaneous `CONNECT` messages that the listener allows for short periods. The burst size cannot be set to 0 (zero). 
When no burst rate is specified, the listener allows a burst rate that is double the defined connect rate.

connectRate.description: The maximum sustained rate of connects that the listener allows per second. The connect rate cannot be set to 0 (zero). The default setting is `500`.

enabled.description: Defines whether connect overload protection is enabled. Possible values are `true` and `false`. The default setting is `true`.

externalTrafficPolicy.description: Describes if the Service routes external traffic to node-local or cluster-wide endpoints. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/networking/virtual-ips/#external-traffic-policy.

hivemqListenerName.description: Defines the optional custom name for the MQTT and WebSocket listeners.

sessionAffinity.description: Used to maintain session affinity. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#virtual-ips-and-service-proxies

type.description: Session affinity type. Must be ClientIP or None. Defaults to `ClientIP` for `control-services` service type.
